messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Socks
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/12/05 2:58:26 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... He actually does wash his own laundry, I happened to walk in the bedroom while he was griping
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/12/05 2:58:26 PM Eastern Standard Time,
UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes:

> I can't
> imagine him ever telling me he's out of socks, and then expecting me to
> wash
> them. He does his own laundry. On Sundays.
>

He actually does wash his own laundry, I happened to walk in the bedroom
while he was griping to himself that there are never any clean socks. I just took
over the guilt.
I'm going to check the cat box.
Elissa


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Socks
messages.msgSnippet: ... They are on the planet next to the one where all the Ball Point Pens live, of course. Bridget ~ /~ ~ /~ ~ /~ ~ /~ ~ /~ ~ /~ ~ /~ ~ /~ ~ /~ ~ /~ ~ /~ ~ /~
messages.messageBody:
> Message: 21
> Date: Sat, 22 Sep 2001 12:33:58 -0700 (PDT)
> From: Sharon Rudd <bearspawprint@...>
> Subject: Odd socks was Does the laundry ever end???
>

> But what I want to know is the ultimate modern
> question of WHERE ARE THE OTHER SOCKS?

They are on the planet next to the one where all the Ball Point Pens
live, of course.

Bridget

messages.subject: Re: Socks
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 09/23/2001 6:15:12 AM Eastern Daylight Time, ... My sister-in-law makes sure that not only are her children s socks clean and matching
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 09/23/2001 6:15:12 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> > My daughter wears two different colored socks. She started it when she was
> > 3 since she wanted more color in her outfits. Now it is part of her
> > fashion. A couple of other girls she plays with have started it too. One
> > is older and she made the comment that she didn't have to sort her socks
> > now.
> > I don't have to sort Megan's socks - they just go in a bin in her drawer
> and
> > she picks out what she wants to wear that day.
> >
>
> Thank you for releasing another law from my head! Just socks, but I'm
> reading
> this thinking, 'can she do that?!? mismatched socks?!? well, I guess she
> could, wow!' Amazing how many guidelines I follow without even thinking
> about
> it.
>
>

My sister-in-law makes sure that not only are her children's socks clean and
matching (something we rarely accomplish around here), but.....they also
match the kids' CLOTHES......

Yeah right.

Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
